On Fri, Mar 10, 2017 at 5:56 AM, Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote: This is a really old torch model. A fix would be to load it in LuaTorch and save it back. Then the issue should be fixed. So: $ th -lnn > m = torch.load("nn4.small2.v1.t7") > torch.save("nn4.small2.v1.t7", m) — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. thank you, so much!!!

Best Regards,
Tae-hoon Kim
…
On Fri, Mar 10, 2017 at 5:56 AM, Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote:
 This is a really old torch model.
 A fix would be to load it in LuaTorch and save it back. Then the issue
 should be fixed.
 So:

 $ th -lnn
 > m = torch.load("nn4.small2.v1.t7")
 > torch.save("nn4.small2.v1.t7", m)

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#956 (comment)>,

 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AG2zCwnQmOO4e5F2hAj_hxgYJGFiSMIZks5rkGeUgaJpZM4MWa-v>
 .
body:
thank you, so much!!!

Best Regards,
Tae-hoon Kim

wrote:

> A fix would be to load it in LuaTorch and save it back. Then the issue
> should be fixed.
> So:

> > m = torch.load("nn4.small2.v1.t7")
> > torch.save("nn4.small2.v1.t7", m)
